**Skrindle in the Gumblerarch**

Beware the blenkish Gumblerarch,  
Where wimblewhinings fizz and flee!  
The yunderpipes yowel and parch  
With plunk-and-plaggle plea.

Prepare thy snuddled splinter-shard,  
For whipplewispings fleem at night.  
Don brustleboots and blonkhead guard—  
A bremmled, blinkling sight.

Through thrumple-woomps, the flapper-glare  
Of riskle-bogs did breep and bay.  
Zop! went the zeegles, thick in air—  
Yet forth I fizzled anyway.

Hark, a griblous! Skrawk and smear—  
Its drimbled nash gnips gnarp and gno!  
With blundleblade, I jounced it near—  
Skree-aw! A twiffling blow.

The Gumblerarch fell still and sleek;  
Sniggling echos twinged the gloom.  
My snuddleshield and boots did creak  
Toward tinkletwangle bloom.

Hurroo! Hurraa! My brattle won!  
Gumblerarch-songs splindle-swell.  
Through plink and prap of cascadone—  
Now festle-waggles dwell.

And still at dusk, the fizzle-flutes  
Of wimblewhinings fizz and flee,  
While under arch and rolly roots  
Plunk-plaggle pleads to me.

**Bramblyblonk in the Mizzlewog**

Bewiskered gloom, the mizzlewog  
Frulupped its shroud about the glen;  
With blinkle-boots and dranny-tog,  
I braced against the gribberden.  

"Beware the Bramblyblonk!" they yipped,  
"The snizzlin' snout, the snozzlecheek!  
Beware its dringle, harrow-tipped—  
Frosh-muffled feet and whindle-beak!"  

So sturchly steeled and thimble-thorned,  
I splindled through the dapplersmeech.  
The crindle-cronk of shabblings warned—  
Blort-blort!—a bramblyblonk in reach!  

It lurked, a blurble-flomp, a ghrast—  
Flumdangled, squindle-paws askew—  
I slashed with flisker fast and vast  
And gabble-gloof! The beast I slew!  

Then hapsterbright, the breezle strode;  
The mist unfrizzled, liftsies high;  
I skimped back home along the road  
While glimble folk let gladgales fly!  

Bewiskered gloom, the mizzlewog  
Yet twinkles round the early den;  
But bramblyblonk, once deep in fog,  
Now snoozles in its snuggle-pen.

**Dezhoovoo and the Rebeeble Blink**

**Bumblebound and the Wending Way**

Bewangle night upon the gribbergreen,  
The rample weeds went shumping by,  
Soft whilfts of whimly, tipple-sheen—  
Beware the Durskling’s eye!  

Becrumple boots and finndle coat,  
A wibble-woven, wormwise map;  
With sense of snootle in the throat,  
And spickets in the trap.  

*Thrum-thrum!*—The path went scroodling skant,  
A ziggle-zag along the sward,

Its flumberfangs were gnard!  

He smaggled, swungle, sprapped about,  
His brinkle-blade in glibber hand,  
The Durskling fell with one glout-shout—  
Snickerthud on clovered land.  

Home-dondle now, the duskly dew,  
The wishwood whispers, trimb and bright,

Soft whimly falls the night.  

Bewangle day on gribbergreen,  
The rample reeds still shumping by,

A clangcrush cap, his wibble noose.

**Lallowicks at Layover Bay**

Bewumble night at Layover Bay,  
Where snicker-tide and slabber foam,  
Grindle-winds wapple round the quay,  
And shadow-vairies loom;  
Beware the Lallowick that lurks below,  
Its glintle eyes agleam with drip,  
It slither-slinks with blazzle-glow,  
And flippers flip-a-flip.

O clutch your clattercloak real tight,  
Tie twindleknots with clish and clang!  
Pack mirrymints and glimmercite,  
Be wary of its fang.  
For shimmer-skitter, plop and spurn,  
The Lallowick will squall,  
With snap and scrumble, round the churn,  
To shake the quartzical wall.

From fumble-reef to dapple-drift,  
With whuffle-wand and bluster-steel,  
I tramped the tussle-mist so swift,  
And scuddled slippey-leel;  
When, whizz-buzz-bang! It sprung astride,  
The Lallowick all spatter-bright!  
Flip-flapping jaws and shimmer-hide—  
We battled through the night.

Fizz-whack and skatter—mad the fray!  
It yowlle-hopped with scroggle spin,  
But with a yaddle-thrust I won the day—  
Its slither-skin grew thin.  
And morn upon that marbly blue,  
I scrolled the brangle shore,  
While pebbles chimed with dew-dew-dew—  
The Lallowick, no more.

So brinble-folk, rejoice and play  
Round giggle-rocks and quaver foam.  
Bewumble night at Layover Bay,  
Where shadow-vairies roam.

The yawpsome wolfwire's gloam.

Upon the bramblish glen,

With brizzle-net of silverrill,  
And cliffle-jangle tone.

"Take up your whindle-waxled boots,"  
So murmled wise old Blur,  
"And clasp thy glimmer-snoot, to suit  
The shundle-shaded stir.  
Remember well, the Floogenbell  
A-cackle in the drift—  
For when it snickety-snacks the dell,  
The squadder-skulls may shift."

Through guggledrees and crue,  
While Fogwibble, in veilish crown,

Its lubber-huff did boom,  
Yet I—armed true with jitter-spear—  
Unwobbled through the gloom.

I woggled, jove and snickerkeen,  
With flutterflap and glint—

With frazzle-fanged hint.  
Schkrackathwack! My blunkle-blade  
Did slish the snarl in two!  
Its squizzlum-howl at last did fade  
To wiffling whiffs of blue.

And floogenbells, in shimmer-play,  
Did ring across the moss.  
For mists that brumbleweep may fall  
And wibble willows bend—

Beware the Fiddlefoggle, wake!

It flapped and slopped in smuddle-grey,  
Its plufflesfins all swick and slick—  
Hiss-whumping through the murkful hay,  
It shrilled a blister-click!

Splinged sharp your brilliblade, you sprang—  
Through fuddlepuff and fiew—you whapped!  
The Fiddlefoggle’s screech-bangs rang,  
As you with clatter capped.

Now sunseams swirl the smotherlight,  
The glimbergreen doth flick and fleet.  
You truddlest home in bloom and bright  
Upon your squampish feet.

Rejoice, my kit! The brume is done!  
With brollifoggles slugged and gone,  
Let bairns go swirling in the sun—  
While through the dimdew shone

The brollifog, so thick and wild,  
With drowsled gloop and dithered mild.  
Yet you, my kit, did never flinch  
From fog that swirled and smiled.

poem:
**Snick-Snappic and the Shimble Reel**

’Twas snick-snappic in the filmflick glen,  
The sprocket-spools did whirrow-wend;  
Beware the shimble, shutt’ry fiend,  
With flashling fangs that bend.

He took his lenskit, roll’ry packed,  
Long-timber’s tripod, twisty tight;  
Frabjous flashcap, click-clack backed  
Against the velvet light.

Fuzzizzle fuzz—the film did swizz—  
And shimble whiffed to pink.

Rejoice! O roll the rattle-spool!  
Sing sprocket’s song with cheery cheer;  
He left the filmflick, feeling cool—  
His photos shimmered clear.

’Twas snick-snappic in the filmflick glen,  
The sprocket-spools did whirrow-wend;  
Beware the shimble, shutt’ry fiend,
